intro: Quaternella confusa, commonly known as the confused quaternella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its appearance includes narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. It plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
